content.raw:
I like the idea of tooltips and a different color for outputs not displaying what the hardware does.
I also think BLACS should display what the hardware does.
But I would argue that inverted shutters are even then currently misrepresented as they are inconsistent with non inverted shutters. At least if you consider the Shutter to be the hardware rather than the output.

Unifying wasn't something I was aiming at but still sounds great and as already mentioned would allow for the inversion via unit conversion.

As for totally getting rid of go_high() go_low() I'm not a fan of, as I don't want to rewrite all our scripts.
But I would be very okay with them in the background just calling do_line.constant(t, 1).
